condition.narrative: Should contribute directly to results for children as outlined in the UNDAF, national results and/or UNICEF Strategic Plan and within the scope defined in the CPD, CPAP, OMP or other agreed upon programme documents

title.narrative: By 2022, the Government, SSSU, ombudsperson system and other stakeholders, have increased capacity to monitor child rights and provide disaggregated and up-to-date data

description.narrative: The 2019 was marked by the exponentially increasing role of UNICEF in supporting the SDGs agenda in Ukraine. The office has mobilized its best technical ability and, within a calendar year, supported the Government to produce the three national reports were: (SDGs for children, SDG 8 (in partnership with UNIDO and with focus on youth), 2019 SDGs progress report). It is remarkable that the President of Ukraine used the data of the 2019 SDG progress report during the UN General assembly meeting in 2019. This culminated with the respective Presidential decree that further streamlined the SDG agenda in Ukraine | Status:On-track | As-of Date:20/01/2020
